record.title: SCHEDULE

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, this morning, the Senate will immediately resume consideration of the U.S. attorneys legislation, S. 214, and conclude the final 90 minutes of debate on this issue.
At approximately 11:30, there will be three rollcall votes to complete action on the bill: Votes on two amendments and then passage of the bill.
At the conclusion of ordering passage on the bill, the Senate will recess for our weekly work conferences.

Following the caucus lunch, we will begin consideration of the budget resolution. Yesterday, I was going to ask unanimous consent to begin at 2:15, but I was informed there might be a request for a rollcall vote on the motion to proceed. That is a nondebatable motion, so we will vote immediately at 2:15 on that matter.

As far as the Democrats' time on this matter, relating to U.S. attorneys, the allocation of time on this side will be Senator Schumer, 5 minutes; Senator Murray, 5 minutes; Senator Cardin, 5 minutes; Senator Klobuchar, 5 minutes; Senator Feinstein, 5 minutes; and the balance of the time will be under the control of Senator Leahy.
Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that be the case.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
